translations.translation: So watch and wait. They too are waiting.
So you wait. They are also waiting.
Wait, then; they too are waiting.
Wait (for God's decree) and they too will be waiting.
Therefore wait (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) – they too are waiting.
Wait then; verily, they (too) are waiting.
Therefore wait; surely they are waiting.
So be on the watch; they too are on the watch.
Wait then (O Muhammad). Lo! they (too) are waiting.
Wait then; they too are waiting.
Wait thou then; verily they also are waiting.
So wait thou and watch; for they (too) are waiting.
Wait then (O Muhammad SAW); Verily, they (too) are waiting.
So be watchful, they too are watching.
So wait and watch. They too are waiting and watching.
So watch, [O Muhammad]; indeed, they are watching [for your end].

[44:59] So be on the look out, await their destruction. Indeed they [too] are on the look out, for your death — this was before the revelation of the command to struggle against them. Meccan, except for verse 14, which is Medinese; it consists of 36 or 37 verses.

(Wait then (0 Muhammad)) their destruction at Badr. (Lo! they (too) are waiting) your destruction; and Allah did indeed destroy them on the Day of Badr'. And of the surah in which Crouching is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 36 verses, 644 words and 2,600 letters: Surah 45: Crouching (al-Jathiyah) And of the surah in which Crouching is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 36 verses, 644 words and 2,600 letters:
